title: The Walking Dead drops first look trailer for latest spin-off series
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Walking Dead’s latest spin-off series has been given a new first-look trailer ahead of its release – though we’re still not getting a name just yet.

New York Comic-Con on Saturday proved to be all about The Walking Dead with trailers and news about what’s in store for the apocalyptic world dominating proceedings.

However, while most were expecting the name of the new series to be released, they were left half-disappointed by getting a gripping trailer about what’s in store.

Wanting more from life than the compound they live in, the young survivors head out on their own (Picture: AMC)

Will they live to regret their decision? (Picture: AMC)

A coming-of-age drama with a little less of a dark tone than the series before it, the untitled new season will see a civilisation set up to include schools and families, all of whom fce the imminent threat of a walker infestation.

With lessons in class including self-defence, the leading characters Aliyah Royale (Iris), Alexa Mansour (Hope), Annet Mahendru (Huck), Nicolas Cantu (Elton), Hal Cumpston (Silas) and Nico Tortorella (Felix) decided to head out on their own adventure.

We’ll follow their story as they decide to leave the compound walls they’ve called home and navigate themselves to a new place of safety.

As the first generation of humans to have lived fully through the walker uprising, are they taking the risks they face as seriously as they should?

Heading over the walls that protect their society, the team look for a new compound to live in (Picture: AMC)

The Walkers will be out in force if they catch on to what they’re up to… (Picture: AMC)

Fan theorists, do your best – we can’t wait to hear what you come up with for a name, and if you’re right.

The upcoming series, which follows on from the main show as well as Fear The Walking Dead, will be added to the Walkerverse in 2020.

We already know that the show will kick off in dramatic fashion with a plane crash tearing through the main character’s lives.

The series is currently being filmed in Virginia, and will comprise of 10 episodes.

‘Some will become heroes. Some will become villains. In the end, all of them will be changed forever. Grown-up and cemented in their identities, both good and bad,’ the synopsis reads.

The Walking Dead returns 7 October at 9pm on Fox in the UK.
